summary: This document is a collection of FAA aircraft registration records for a Gulfstream G550 (serial number 5173) with tail numbers N673GA, N401HB, N415LM, N212JE, and N550GP. It shows the aircraft's ownership transfers from Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation to Chevron U.S.A. Inc., then to Plan D LLC, then to Six G Aviation LLC, and finally to N550GP LLC. The records include bills of sale, registration applications, declarations of international operations, and requests for special registration numbers.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.context: Signed multiple documents as the Manager of Plan D LLC, the owner of the aircraft, including registration renewals and a request to change the tail number.

persons.name: Nancy
persons.context: Addressed in a letter from Lawrence Visoski requesting approval to apply a new N number to the aircraft.

persons.name: Lisa Thomas
persons.role: Contact at ARTC (Aero Records & Title Co.)
persons.context: Mentioned in a 2007 letter as the contact if requested registration numbers are not available.

persons.name: Carol Rowley
persons.context: Listed as a carbon copy recipient on a 2007 request for manufacturer registration number assignments.

connections.description: Lawrence Visoski is the Manager of Plan D LLC, as indicated on multiple signed documents.

events.title: International flight to London
events.description: A Declaration of International Operations states the aircraft (N401HB) is scheduled for an international flight from Oakland, California to London, England.

events.title: International flight to Aspen
events.description: A Declaration of International Operations states the aircraft (N550GP) is scheduled for an international flight from Teterboro, New Jersey to Aspen, Colorado.

events.title: International flight to Cabo San Lucas
events.description: A Declaration of International Operations states the aircraft (N212JE) is scheduled for an international flight from Chino, California to Cabo San Lucas, Mexico.

events.title: International flight to Geneva
events.description: A Declaration of International Operations states the aircraft (N415LM) is scheduled for an international flight from Teterboro, New Jersey to Geneva, Switzerland.

events.title: Aircraft sale to N550GP LLC
events.description: An Aircraft Bill of Sale records the sale of the aircraft (N212JE) from Six G Aviation LLC to N550GP LLC for $1.00 plus OVC.

events.title: Aircraft sale to Six G Aviation LLC
events.description: An Aircraft Bill of Sale records the sale of the aircraft (N212JE) from Plan D LLC to Six G Aviation LLC for $1.00 plus OVC.

events.title: Aircraft sale to Plan D LLC
events.description: An Aircraft Bill of Sale records the sale of the aircraft (N415LM) from Chevron U.S.A. Inc. to Plan D LLC for $1.00 plus OVC.

events.title: Aircraft sale to Chevron U.S.A. Inc.
events.description: An Aircraft Bill of Sale records the sale of the aircraft (N401HB) from Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation to Chevron U.S.A. Inc. for $1.00 plus OVC.

keyFacts: The Gulfstream G550 (serial 5173) was originally manufactured and registered to Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation as N673GA in 2007.
The aircraft's ownership trail is: Gulfstream Aerospace Corp -> Chevron U.S.A. Inc. (2008) -> Plan D LLC (2017) -> Six G Aviation LLC (2020) -> N550GP LLC (2020).
Multiple declarations of international flights show the aircraft's travel to destinations like London, Geneva, Cabo San Lucas, and Aspen.
Several bills of sale record transfers of the aircraft for a nominal consideration of $1.00 plus OVC (other valuable consideration).
The final registered owner in these documents is N550GP LLC of Ontario, California, with a special registration number change from N212JE to N550GP in 2021.
